intro: Bryodesma scopulorum, commonly known as the rock liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is typically found growing on rocky surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in harsh, dry conditions. The plant has a compact, cushion-like growth form, with closely packed leaves that help reduce water loss. Its structure consists of a thallus with distinct leaf-like structures and specialized cells for absorbing moisture from the environment. Bryodesma scopulorum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms in its ecosystem.
